document.docAuthor: Golovatch, Sergei I., Geoffroy, Jean-Jacques, Mauriès, Jean-Paul & Vandenspiegel, Didier
document.docTitle: Plusioglyphiulus panhai Golovatch & Geoffroy & Mauriès & Vandenspiegel 2011, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: The millipede genus Plusioglyphiulus Silvestri, 1923 in Thailand (Diplopoda, Spirostreptida, Cambalopsidae) 2940

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The millipede genus Plusioglyphiulus Silvestri, 1923 in Thailand (Diplopoda, Spirostreptida, Cambalopsidae) 2940

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined:
Holotype male ( MNHN GA 072 ), Thailand , Phachuap Khiri Khan Prov. , Sam Roi Yot Distr. , Cave Tham Sai near sea shore,
20 m a.s.l.
,
14 December 2009
, leg. S. Panha and members of the Animal Systematics Research Unit
.
Paratypes : 1 male , 1 female ( MNHN GA 072 )
,
1 male , 1 female ( ZMUM )
,
1 male , 1 female ( MZCU )
,
1 female ( ZMUC )
,
1 male ( SEM )
,
same locality, together with holotype
.

Name: Honours Professor Somsak Panha, one of the collectors and the leader of a highly active group of invertebrate taxonomists (the Animal Systematics Research Unit) at Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok , Thailand .

Diagnosis: Differs from congeners in the peculiar, reduced carinotaxy of the metaterga, e.g. the presence of only two, not the usual three, transverse rows of crests on the metaterga, coupled with the small central outgrowth on male leg-pair 1, by the simple, plate-like anterior gonopods vividly resembling those in most of
Glyphiulus species
, and the complex posterior gonopods whose coxites are densely setose paramedially and supplied apically with a large fovea and an evident uncus, while the telopodites are evident and digitiform.
Description: Length 31–45 mm , width 1.3–1.7 mm , collum and midbody segments being equally broadest. Coloration uniformly dark grey-brown; antennae lighter, usually yellow-brown; legs red-brown.
Body with 68–77p+2a+T. Length of holotype about 41 mm , width 1.7 mm , with 76p+2a+T.

Clypeus with three teeth anteromedially. Antennae short and clavate ( Figs 1A , 4A ), antennomeres 6 and 7 each with a small group of bacilliform sensilla distodorsally ( Fig. 4A ). Ocellaria large, vague due to complete depigmentation, ovoid in shape, with ocelli arranged at least in five longitudinal rows. Gnathochilarium ( Figs 2A , 4B ) rather polytrichous, with a separate promentum (n=2).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Plusioglyphiulus panhai
sp. n.
, male paratype. A: anterior part of body, lateral view. B: midbody segments, lateral view. C: posterior part of body, lateral view. D: anterior part of body, dorsal view. E: midbody segments, dorsal view. F: posterior part of body, dorsal view. Scale bars: A, C–F, 0.2 mm; B, 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 2.
Plusioglyphiulus panhai
sp. n.
, male paratype. A: gnathochilarium, ventral view. B: body segments 2–5 with legs 1–5, ventral view. C: midbody segments, ventral view. D: posterior part of body, caudal view. E: cross-section of a midbody segment, caudal view. F: midbody leg. Scale bars: A and F, 0.1 mm; B–E, 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs rather short, nearly as long as body diameter ( Figs 2C, E ), claws with an evident and long spine near base ( Figs 2F , 3A , 4F ). Tarsi and tarsal setae very delicately fringed.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Plusioglyphiulus panhai
sp. n.
, male paratype. A: enlarged claw with a basal setoid filament, subdorsal view. B: both gonopod pairs in situ, caudal view. C: enlarged right half of same, caudal view. D: anterior gonopods in situ, caudal view. Scale bars: A, 0.01 mm; B and D, 0.1 mm; C, 0.05 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male legs 1 with an unusually short central hook and relatively moderately reduced, 3-segmented appendages ( Figs 2B , 4C ). Male legs 2 rather modestly enlarged, telopodite hirsute on frontal face; penes subtriangular, fused at base, with 2+2 long setae ( Figs 2B , 4D ). Male legs 3 as usual, with particularly elongate and slender coxae, and shortened telopodites ( Figs 2B , 4E ).
